serStmt.serName: Medijska pismenost v Sloveniji = Media Literacy in Slovenia
serStmt.serInfo: Media literacy research is the first comprehensive research in Slovenia. The research work draws on a number of already existing studies and analysis of primary and secondary data. The data is collected within the Infrastructural programme of the Faculty of Media and is the basis for the analysis of media literacy and media use in Slovenia. The research has begun in 2014, covering fields of media use, online security, media education, use of social networks, media exposure and use of electronic devices, the impact of media on people's daily lives, the importance of privacy and the security of sharing personal information online. Within the media research, different age groups are included - general representative population of Slovenia and individual groups such as primary school children, high school students, preschool children, the unemployed and hearing impaired and visually impared or partially sighted.

citation.biblCit: Rek, M., Kovačič, A. and Milanovski Brumat, K. (2020). Media and seniors (65 and above), 2018 [Data file]. Ljubljana: Univerza v Ljubljani = University of Ljubljana, Arhiv družboslovnih podatkov = Social Science Data Archives. ADP - IDNo: MPSTR18. https://doi.org/10.17898/ADP_MPSTR18_V1

subject.keyword: use of information and communication means
subject.topcClas: MEDIA, COMMUNICATION AND LANGUAGE - Information society

stdyInfo.abstract: The purpose of the study was to gather data on media behaviour of elderly people, 65 years old or more. The goal was to determine their ability of critical evaluation of information, given by the media and their exposure to media. Covered topics are: the daily use of media, media related activities, use of social networks, internet and smart phones. 322 respondents participated in the study.

sumDscr.universe: Elderly, 65 years old or more, from the Republic of Slovenia, living at home or are in institutional care (nursing homes).

dataColl.dataCollector: Fakulteta za medije = Faculty of Media
dataColl.sampProc: 486 respondents, older than 65, were contacted on field. The selection took into account the approximate layout of respondents by gender, age and geographical coverage. They were personally invited to participate. The final sample of respondents was 322. Of these, 28 surveys were conducted in nursing homes.
dataColl.collSitu: All surveys were filled-in in the presence of a researcher. 31.4% of the surveys were fulfilled on paper and then entered electronically by a researcher. In other cases, the researcher entered answers directly to the electronic survey format.

method.stdyClas: 7 - studies that permits theoretical generalisations or relates on a practical problem, less influential

setAvail.accsPlac: Arhiv družboslovnih podatkov = Social Science Data Archives

useStmt.deposReq: Users are requested to deposit with the Archive two copies of any published work or report based wholly or in part on such materials and to notify the Archive of any errors discovered in the materials.
useStmt.conditions: In case of ambiguity the users of the data set are advised to contact principal investigators or Archive.

var.name: v1
var.labl: Koliko gledate televizijo, video ali filme?

var.labl: Koliko poslušate radijski program?
